name: Baked Italian Pumpkin Blossoms Stuffed with Ricotta (Fiori di Zucca Ripieni di Ricotta)
author: RitaCiu
summary: Pumpkin blossoms are only in season for a short time, so make sure you try this delicious Italian appetizer where they are stuffed with ricotta cheese, Parmesan cheese, and mint, then baked in the oven. You can also prepare zucchini blossoms this way.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil, or as needed
9 ounces fresh ricotta cheese, well drained
4 leaves fresh mint, sliced, or more to taste
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and drizzle with olive oil
Remove stamens from blossoms, wash, and dry well
Combine ricotta, egg, Parmesan cheese, nutmeg, mint, salt, and pepper in a bowl; mix well
Carefully stuff about 1 tablespoon ricotta mixture into each pumpkin blossom and pinch the ends closed
Place on the prepared baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until browned, about 20 minutes
